section.para: Even though it is based on a flow of documents related to a business transaction between a buyer and seller, the Standby Letter of Credit is not directly related to the movement of goods.

It acts more like a guarantee. It means the beneficiary will receive a payment from the Issuing Bank in the event of default on a contract, provided that the complying documents (usually a sight draft) are presented.
A Standby Letter of Credit can be governed by either the UCP 500 rules or the more specific ISP 98 practices.

For business transactions that require regular exchanges between a buyer and a seller, a Standby Letter of Credit can include an Evergreen clause. This means the guarantee is automatically regularly renewed and so does not have an expiry date.

section.title: Flow of a Standby Letter of Credit
section.para: The life of a Standby Letter of Credit is similar to a commercial Letter of Credit as seen in the Import Letter of Credit module.

Once a contract has been signed, the buyer (applicant) asks his bank to issue an irrevocable Standby Letter of Credit in favour of the seller (beneficiary). The issuance and notification can be done directly by the Issuing Bank. It is usually recommended that the beneficiary should ask one of its local banks to add its confirmation.

The seller can draw on the guarantee by producing documents testifying that he has fulfilled his part of the contract and that the buyer has not. For that purpose, he attaches to his documents a signed certificate indicating that the applicant has not performed the required payment. Then the bank that issued the Standby Letter of Credit is should normally pay at sight.

Because this document checking and payment occur only in a case of default, a Standby Letter of Credit is generally considered simpler, quicker and cheaper than a standard commercial Letter of Credit.

section.title: Overview
section.para: This Standby Letter of Credit module (SI) is similar to the module. It enables you, on behalf of your company (the applicant), to initiate Standby Letter of Credit requests, submit them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently amend, follow up and maintain them and exchange messages about them with this bank.

section.para: Create a free-format Standby Letter of Credit initiation, and optionally attach a file containing the details.

section.title: SI Initiation - Back to Back SI
section.para: A Back-to-Back Credit is also known as a Counter Credit. It is often used as a method of finance to enable an export agent to buy goods from a supplier or manufacturer and sell them to a final buyer with a settlement effected by documentary credits.
In practice, the Back-to-Back SI can be described as a SI initiated by the applicant from the details of an Export Letter of Credit for which the applicant is designated as the beneficiary.
You can then create a SI in a similar way to when you create one from an existing SI.
Note that the system does not prevent you from opening several SIs from the same SI record.
Complete or change the required fields in the rest of the form and click the Submit button at the top (or bottom) of the screen when ready.

section.title: SI Initiation - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows an SI that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of SIs that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: SI Initiation - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows a SI that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by and authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of SIs that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Message to Bank Options
section.para: This part of the menu contains several options, providing different ways to send a free-format message to the Issuing Bank.

A typical use is to reply to a notification of discrepancies on documents presented to the Issuing Bank, or to the acceptance of a draft.
From Existing SI
Displays a list of existing Issued Standby Letters of Credit.
From Discrepant SI
Create a message from a discrepancy report.
Claim Processing
Create a message for claim presentation of a SI.
Action Required
Review and act on any message from the bank that requires your response.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Message to Bank - Claim Processing
section.para: This option allows you to communicate with the bank for requesting a settlement for the SI and to process the claim.

When selected, this option presents a list of Message to Bank records that requires customers to present a request for settlement of the SI. The records displayed here follows a process where you have to initiate (to initiate a SI, refer to the topic SI Initiation) and submit a SI to the Bank, and the Bank approves your SI in the back-office from Pending Records. The record then moves to the Existing Records section in the back-office. You are expected to enter the claim details for the SI on this screen and submit it to the Bank for further processing.

section.title: Edit Transactions
section.para: Review, complete and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.

note.para: For an Issued SLC that you have marked as provisional, the Bank may move it to either of the two statuses: 'Wording Under Review' or 'Final Wording'. Open the provisional Issued SLC and either 'Accept' or 'Reject' with your reasons and supporting file uploads. This negotiation of the terms of the Issued SLC by marking it provisional is the Client Wording feature. The provisional Issued SLC status remains 'Wording Under Review' till the Bank User changes it to 'Final Wording'. You can open and review the transaction with the status 'Final Wording' and either Accept or Reject it. Accepting it will give the choice to the Bank User to register the transaction, and rejecting it will provide the option for another cycle of negotiations based on your inputs. Once accepted by you, the provisional Issued SLC moves from the Existing Records to the Pending Records > List of Records of the Bank User. From here, the Bank User can select the appropriate option for the Issued SLC from: Wording Under Review, Final Wording, Approved and Not Processed. You can find any Approved or Not Processed Issued SLC through the SI Inquiry menu with a detailed history of the transaction.

section.para: This function is user to maintain Export Letters of Credit records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now set an entity for the SI by clicking the search icon

section.para: Assign a customer reference to a SI record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: SI Maintenance - Unsigned SIs
section.para: List and optionally delete SI transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: SI Maintenance - Purged SIs
section.para: List and optionally delete Issued Standby LC transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of SI records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
